code_quality.justification: Clean, readable code with consistent naming conventions (camelCase for JS/JSX, clear function names). Backend models follow consistent patterns with async/await. React components use functional patterns with hooks correctly. Good use of destructuring and modern JS. Limited inline comments but code is self-documenting. No JSDoc on frontend hooks, some JSDoc-style comments on backend error functions. Type hints absent (plain JS, not TypeScript).

architecture.justification: Excellent separation of concerns: backend has clear layers (routes -> models -> db), frontend has good component hierarchy (App -> Board -> Column -> Card) with custom hooks for state management (useBoard, useApi, useDragDrop, useReports). RESTful API design is clean. Reports module cleanly separated. The fractional indexing approach for positioning is well-designed. Minor weakness: some coupling in useBoard hook managing all board state operations could be split further. No dependency injection pattern but acceptable for this scope.

test_quality.justification: Comprehensive API tests covering CRUD operations, validation errors, not-found errors, and edge cases (empty names, invalid IDs, whitespace trimming). Reports tests include filter combinations, sorting validation, CSV escaping edge cases, and null handling. Good use of Jest mocking for database. Tests are well-organized by endpoint with clear describe/it blocks. Missing: no frontend tests were found in the reviewed files (only backend tests present), no integration tests with actual database, and no E2E tests. Coverage appears to target 80%+ for backend based on test breadth.

error_handling.justification: Centralized error handler middleware with proper HTTP status codes (400, 404, 409, 500). Custom error factory functions (notFoundError, validationError) for consistent error creation. Input validation on all routes (type checking, empty string handling, numeric ID parsing with isNaN checks). Frontend useApi hook properly handles non-ok responses and extracts error messages. PostgreSQL constraint violations (23505) mapped to 409 Conflict. CSV export properly escapes special characters. Minor gap: no request timeout handling, no rate limiting mentioned, database connection errors could be more gracefully handled.

summary: Solid mid-to-senior level full-stack implementation. Strong architecture with clear separation of concerns and good RESTful API design. Backend tests are comprehensive with edge cases covered, though frontend tests appear missing. Error handling is thorough with centralized middleware. Code is clean and readable, following React 18 functional patterns and Express best practices. The fractional indexing for drag-and-drop ordering is a thoughtful design choice. Main improvement areas: add TypeScript for type safety, add frontend component tests, and consider splitting the large useBoard hook.
